abstract.p: We present formulas that allow us to decompose a function ƒ of d variables into a sum of 2 d terms f u indexed by subsets u of {1,. . . , d}, where each term f u depends only on the variables with indices in u. The decomposition depends on the choice of d commuting projections $\{ P_j \} _j^d = 1$ , where P j (ƒ ) does not depend on the variable x j . We present an explicit formula for f u , which is new even for the ANOVA and anchored decompositions; both are special cases of the general decomposition. We show that the decomposition is minimal in the following sense: if f is expressible as a sum in which there is no term that depends on all of the variables indexed by the subset z, then, for every choice of $\{ P_j \} _j^d = 1$ , the terms f u = 0 for all subsets u containing z. Furthermore, in a reproducing kernel Hubert space setting, we give sufficient conditions for the terms f u to be mutually orthogonal.
